turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new games to play. I'm really into RPGs and strategy games, but I'm open to other genres too. Any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Based on your preferences, I can recommend some titles. For RPGs, have you played 'The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt' or 'Divinity: Original Sin 2'? Both are highly acclaimed. For strategy, 'Civilization VI' and 'Stellaris' are great choices. Would you like more information on any of these, or perhaps some suggestions from different genres?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I've played The Witcher 3 and loved it, and I've heard of Divinity but never played it. Tell me more about Stellaris though. I tried playing a space strategy game a while ago and it was a total disaster - too complicated. Is Stellaris easier to get into?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Stellaris can be complex, yes. It has a steep learning curve. However, compared to other grand strategy games, it has a more streamlined tutorial and some very good quality of life features. There are also plenty of online resources and guides, and a very active community, which can help with learning the game. That being said, the complexity is the reason why Stellaris is one of the most loved games of the genre... If you are looking for something easier, you may want to try something else. Perhaps 'Age of Wonders 4', a fantasy strategy game with a more forgiving gameplay?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, that's helpful, thanks. Actually, what about action RPGs? Something like Diablo but maybe... different. Any good suggestions, or is that too broad of a category?
